title: 112_hr3351
content: The Act titled "Franchise Education for Veterans Act" allows the use of educational assistance for franchise training. The GI Bill has been amended to include various education programs for individuals not on active duty, such as apprenticeship, on-job training, cooperative programs, and training at approved establishments. Additionally, limitations on educational assistance have been added to the Act. The GI Bill has been amended to include education programs for individuals not on active duty, such as apprenticeship, on-job training, cooperative programs, and training at approved establishments. The amount of educational assistance payable for a training program at a specified establishment is limited to fees, housing stipend, and a monthly stipend. The GI Bill provides educational assistance for training programs, covering books, supplies, equipment, and other educational costs up to $15,000. The number of months of entitlement charged is based on the total amount of educational assistance paid divided by the full-time monthly institutional rate. Payment cannot exceed the individual's available entitlement, and adjustments may be made for certain individuals. The GI Bill provides educational assistance up to $15,000 for training programs. Veterans may receive up to 12 months of assistance. Adjustments may be made by the Secretary based on the rate of educational assistance. Amendments are made to the Post-9/11 GI Bill for approved programs and franchise training. The GI Bill offers up to $15,000 for training programs at approved establishments, including fees and a monthly housing stipend based on the basic allowance for housing. Veterans can receive up to 12 months of assistance. Adjustments may be made by the Secretary as needed. The GI Bill provides up to $15,000 for training programs at approved establishments, along with a monthly housing stipend for dependents in pay grade E-5. The GI Bill provides up to $15,000 in educational assistance, with a limit of 12 months of benefits. Payments are determined based on percentages applicable to monthly amounts payable under specific subsections. The GI Bill provides educational assistance for training programs at specified establishments, with payments made upon certification of enrollment by the Secretary.
